snippet: Paperwork required to opt out of coverage is part of a struggle to balance religious freedom and women’s rights.
abstract: Two-page federal form required to allow religious organizations to opt out of providing contraceptive coverage has become latest focal point in battle to balance religious freedom and women's rights under the Affordable Care Act; organizations say that by signing form, they would be authorizing insurers or plan administrators to pay for contraception in violation of their beliefs; chart highlights and examines form's contents.
lead_paragraph: Paperwork required to opt out of coverage is part of a struggle to balance religious freedom and women’s rights.

headline.main: A Two-Page Form Spawns a Contraceptive Showdown
headline.print_headline: A Two-Page Form Spawns an Ideological Showdown

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
